title: Stay Connected
subtitle: Join our vibrant community and stay updated with the latest news, insights, and behind-the-scenes content from Hermes Science.

articles.title: Conference on Design Transformation with Artificial Intelligence at ENEFA
articles.excerpt: We shared our top new paradigms that are transforming design in the 21st century: Deep Learning for AI, Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Home Automation, Immersive Experiences and 3D Scans. These innovations are redefining how we conceptualize and interact with spaces.
articles.author: Hermes Dot Science

articles.title: UNPHU adopts Hermes Dot Science as a strategic AI and VR consultant
articles.excerpt: We showcased our virtual reality experience developed for the Virtual Laboratory of the National Brain Bank at the Pedro Henr√≠quez Ure√±a National University. We guided the Minister of Higher Education through the metaverse at the inauguration of the Center for Artificial Intelligence Research and Ethics.
articles.author: Hermes Dot Science

articles.title: Talk about AI empowerment for the Ministry of Education at the First Congress on High Abilities
articles.excerpt: We are very grateful to be able to share some concepts about artificial intelligence with the teachers of the Ministry of Education at the First Congress on High Abilities. Here, the goal was to make teachers understand how AI can enhance high abilities in students. However, we must always keep in mind that if we enhance something small, the result will be better, but still small. By empowering ourselves as human beings, a tool like AI can make us achieve majestic results.
articles.author: Hermes Dot Science

posts.caption: Displacement mapping is a technique that uses a height map or any grayscale texture to deform the geometry of a 3D model at render time. Unlike Bump or Normal Maps, this effect generates real relief that affects both the silhouette and shadow of the object. üí° #3DGraphics #DisplacementMap #TechEducation #3DModeling #ComputerGraphics

Normal mapping uses the R, G, B components of a texture to indicate the X, Y, Z directions of normals at each point on the surface. This technique is widely used in video games to achieve highly detailed surfaces without needing to handle a high polygon count. üéÆ #NormalMap #GameDev #3DGraphics #TechTips #Rendering

Bump mapping is a grayscale texture that simulates small surface variations without modifying the model's geometry. It tricks the rendering engine by changing how light interacts with the surface, creating the illusion of relief. üîç #BumpMap #3DRendering #TechEducation #ComputerGraphics #VisualEffects
